availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Married Sarah Hughes. Father of Samuel G. Hughes, William F. Hughes, John Hughes, Margaret Hughes, James Hughes, and George Hughes. Married Mary Elizabeth Lewis Hughes on June 1, 1854. Father of J. Hughes, M. Hughes, and W. L. Hughes. Farmer in Hancock County in 1850. Owned two enslaved people in Hancock County in 1850. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Unnamed District, p. 293 B; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Unnamed District, p. 257; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Unnamed District, p. 54; "Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954," FamilySearch, https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:FWY5-ZQ8, (accessed September 13, 2017).
